title: Detecting Signals of CCP Central Propaganda Behavior Using Weibo Data Related to Fukushima Nuclear Waste Water
subtitle: IORG Alert No. 49 2023.8.7-9.10
authorInfoItemsHTML:
• Author = Shaohong Lin
  • Author = Chihhao Yu

sections.titleText: 1. Overall “Cooling” of the Fukushima Issue, Including Rapid Decrease of Related “Hot Search” Entries
3. CCP Central Is the First to Initiate and the First to Withdraw

html:
Summary

  • Exploratory data analysis on Weibo posts and Weibo Hot Search entries from August 7th to September 10th, 2023 (archived in IORG Information Environment Archive) provides signals that CCP central actors have been “cooling down” circulation of content related to the release of Fukushima nuclear waste water.
  • Additional cases are required to determine the effectiveness of the methodology proposed in this article.

Data Sources

Weibo posts

  • Weibo posts published by approx. 150,000 accounts that has 50,000 followers or above between August 7th – September 10th, 2023
  • Post contain must match the query {福島, 日本, 東京, 東電, 福岛, 东京, 东电} + {廢水, 處理水, 核汙水, 核污水, 核汙染水, 核污染水, 废水, 处理水}
  • Data set contains approx. 46,000 posts

Weibo Hot Search (微博热搜)

  • Weibo Hot Search hourly top 50 entries between August 7th – September 10th, 2023 (35 days)
  • Entry text must match the query {廢水, 處理水, 汙水, 污水, 汙染水, 污染水, 废水, 处理水}
  • Data set contains approx. 42,000 entries

1. Overall “Cooling” of the Fukushima Issue, Including Rapid Decrease of Related “Hot Search” Entries

  • Content coverage of the Fukushima (nuclear waste water) issue has decreased on Weibo since the release date (August 24th), multiple measurements show.

2. Decreased CCP “Control” Over Fukushima Issue

  • CCP content and narrative coverage show CCP “control” over the Fukushima issue has decreased before the release date.
  • Coverage of Fukushima-related content published by CCP-sanctioned accounts has decreased. Coverage is the percentage of issue-related CCP posts over all issue-related Weibo posts on a single day.
  • Coverage of Fukushima-related narratives created by CCP-sanctioned accounts has also decreased. Coverage is the percentage of newly-created issue-related CCP narratives over all newly-created issue-related narratives on a single day.
  • CCP-sanctioned accounts are Weibo accounts owned or controlled by entities included in the “Entity List of Internet News Information Source” (互联网新闻信息稿源单位名单) issued by the Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC, 国家互联网信息办公室, 网信办).

3. CCP Central Is the First to Initiate and the First to Withdraw

  • Central narrative coverage and assimilation coverage show that the CCP Central is the first to initiate propaganda on the Fukushima issue, and also the first to withdraw.
  • Coverage of narratives created by CCP Central has decreased since August 29th, 5 days after the release date. First day of zero-coverage was September 4th. Coverage is the percentage of issue-related narratives newly-created by CCP Central accounts over all issue-related narratives newly-created by CCP-sanctioned accounts.
  • Assimilation rate of narratives created by CCP Central has increased since August 27th, 3 days after the release date. A post (P) is considered assimilated by another post (P0) when P and P0 belong to the same narrative and P0 is the first post within the lifecycle of that narrative. Assimilation rate coverage is the percentage of posts assimilated by CCP Central narratives over posts assimilated by all CCP narratives.
